pull.title: doc: Rewrite shell example to not leave secrets in the history file

issue.title: Add warning about shell history file

events.body: I think this warning should be separate, at the end of the section. It might be worthwhile to add it, as a reminder, but commands possibly ending up in shell history is nothing new. It has nothing to do with this functionality change.

What about dropping echo instead?

```
    $ src/bitcoin-cli -stdin walletpassphrase
    mysecretcode
    120
    Ctrl+D
    $
```
That's fine with me. Make sure that the Ctrl-D stands out as a key action, not as literally typing Ctrl-D.

events.message: Rewrite shell example to not leave secrets in the history file

events.body: Done. I'm open for better "stand out" for Ctrl-D :-)

rename.from: Add warning about shell history file
rename.to: doc: Rewrite shell example to not leave secrets in the history file

issue.title: Update release-notes.md
issue.body: echo shows up in process history too

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -63,6 +63,10 @@ For example:
 
     $ echo -e "mysecretcode\n120" | src/bitcoin-cli -stdin walletpassphrase
 
+Warning: when used as described, the command line (including your secret
+walletpassphrase) will be stored in your shell history file. Modify your
+command line or your shell settings to prevent it.
+
 It is recommended to use this for sensitive information such as wallet
comments.body: I don't think this quite connects with the next paragraph anymore..
